translated: In every posadha, in every posadha. As follows: In a certain residence, many monks wish to enter the last rainy season.
They think like this:

original: amukasya bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣa amukasya bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣa iti /
analyzed: amukasya bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣa amukasya bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ iti
translated: The Prātimokṣa is recited for such-and-such a monk, the Prātimokṣa is recited for such-and-such a monk.

original: teṣāṃ tad eva poṣadhe pañcadaśyāṃ na kasyacid bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām tat eva poṣadhe pañcadaśyām na kasyacid bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ
translated: On that very posadha day of the fifteenth, the Prātimokṣa is not recited for any monk.
The Blessed One said:

original: sa tair bhikṣubhir bhikṣuḥ paryeṣitavyaḥ vastuparihāreṇa śayanāsanaparihāreṇa karmaparihāreṇa lābhaparihāreṇopasthāyakaparihāreṇa yasya bhikṣor
analyzed: sa taiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ bhikṣuḥ paryeṣitavyaḥ vastu parihāreṇa śayana āsana parihāreṇa karma parihāreṇa lābha parihāreṇa upasthāyaka parihāreṇa yasya bhikṣoḥ
translated: That monk should be sought by those monks in terms of the place, in terms of the dwelling, in terms of the duties, in terms of the gains, and in terms of the attendants, for which monk
the Prātimokṣa is being recited.
If it is successful, then it is good.

original: nocet saṃpadyate na tair bhikṣubhis tasminn āvāse paścimikāṃ varṣām upagantavyaṃ /
analyzed: no ced saṃpadyate na taiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ tasmin āvāse paścimikām varṣām upagantavyam
translated: If it is not successful, those monks should not enter the latter rainy season in that residence.
If they enter, they commit an offense.

original: Poṣv / yathāpi tad anyatamasminn āvāse saṃbahulā bhikṣavaḥ paścimikāṃ varṣām upagantā bhavanti /
analyzed: yathā api tat anyatamasmin āvāse saṃbahulāḥ bhikṣavaḥ paścimikām varṣām upagantā bhavanti
translated: Just as, in a certain residence, many monks enter the latter rainy season.
They think like this:

original: amukasya bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ amukasya bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣa iti /
analyzed: amukasya bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ amukasya bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ iti
translated: The Prātimokṣa is being recited for such-and-such a monk, the Prātimokṣa is being recited for such-and-such a monk.

original: teṣāṃ tad eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyāṃ na kasyacid bhikṣor uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām tat eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyām na kasyacid bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ
translated: On that very Poṣadha day of the fifteenth, the Prātimokṣa is not being recited for any monk.
The Blessed One said:

original: tair bhikṣubhiḥ tasminn āvāse dvau māsau pratisaṃkhyāya vastavyam dvayor māsayor
analyzed: taiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ tasmin āvāse dvau māsau pratisaṃkhyāya vastavyam dvayoḥ māsayoḥ
translated: Those monks should, after consideration, stay in that residence for two months. In two months,

original: atyayād bhikṣuḥ paryeṣitavyaḥ vastuparihāreṇa śayanāsanaparihāreṇa karmaparihāreṇa
analyzed: atyayāt bhikṣuḥ paryeṣitavyaḥ vastu parihāreṇa śayana āsana parihāreṇa karma parihāreṇa
translated: A monk should be sought after the lapse of time, by means of avoiding objects, avoiding bedding and seats, avoiding duties,

analyzed: lābha parihāreṇa upasthāyaka parihāreṇa yasya bhikṣoḥ uddiśyate prātimokṣaḥ
translated: by means of avoiding gains, and by means of avoiding attendants - for which monk the Prātimokṣa is recited.
In the Poṣadha (ceremony).
If it is successful, then it is good.

original: nocet saṃpadyate na tair bhikṣubhir asminn āvāse anyaṃ poṣadhaṃ āgamayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: no ced saṃpadyate na taiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ asmin āvāse anyam poṣadham āgamayitavyaḥ
translated: If it is not successful, those monks should not bring another Poṣadha into this residence.
If they bring it in, they commit an offense.

original: Poṣv / āyuṣmān upālī buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ pṛcchati / GBM /
analyzed: āyuṣmān upālī buddham bhagavantam pracch SPr3In
translated: In the Poṣadha (ceremony), the Venerable Upāli asks the Blessed Buddha:

original: yathāpi tad bhadanta naivāsikā bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇvanti āgantukā bhikṣava āgacchanti sūtradharā vinayadharā mātṛkādharā iti /
analyzed: yathā api tat bhadanta naivāsikāḥ bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇvanti āgantukāḥ bhikṣavaḥ āgacchanti sūtra dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātṛkā dharāḥ iti
translated: As, Venerable One, resident monks hear that visiting monks who are experts in the Sūtra, experts in the Vinaya, and experts in the Mātṛkā are coming,
how should they act towards them?

original: tair upāliṃ bhikṣubhiḥ sūtradharavinayadharamātṛkādharāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇām arthāya ardhatṛtīyāni yojanāni chatradhvajapatākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyaṃ
analyzed: taiḥ upālim bhikṣubhiḥ sūtradhara vinayadhara mātṛkādharāṇām bhikṣūṇām arthāya ardhatṛtīyāni yojanāni chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyam
translated: Upāli, those monks should go out to meet the monks who are experts in the Sūtra, experts in the Vinaya, and experts in the Mātṛkā, carrying parasols, banners, and flags for three and a half yojanas,🔽for the sake of the monks who are experts in the Sūtra, experts in the Vinaya, and experts in the Mātṛkā.
If it is successful, then it is good.

original: nocet saṃpadyate paṃca krośāni chatradhvajapatākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyaṃ /
analyzed: no ced saṃpadyate paṃca krośāni chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyam
translated: If not, he should go out to meet them for five krośas with parasols, banners, and flags.
If that is accomplished, it is good.

original: nocet saṃpadyate trīṅ krośān ardhakrośam antataḥ pariṣaṇḍām api chatradhvajapatākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyaṃ /
analyzed: no ced saṃpadyate trīn krośān ardha krośam antatas pariṣaṇḍām api chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ pratyudgantavyam
translated: If not, he should go out to meet them for three krośas, half a krośa, or at least to the outskirts with parasols, banners, and flags.
If that is accomplished, it is good.

original: nocet saṃpadyate snātraṃ kartavyaṃ saṃghe snehalābhaḥ kartavyaḥ /🔽Poṣv / / teṣāṃ vastuparihāraḥ śayanāsanaparihāraḥ karmaparihāraḥ lābhaparihāra upasthāyakaparihāro dātavyaḥ /
analyzed: no ced saṃpadyate snātram kartavyam saṃghe sneha lābhaḥ kartavyaḥ  teṣām vastu parihāraḥ śayana āsana parihāraḥ karma parihāraḥ lābha parihāraḥ upasthāyaka parihāraḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: If not, he should perform a bathing ceremony and make an offering of affection to the Saṅgha.
He should give them the avoidance of property, the avoidance of bedding and seats, the avoidance of duties, the avoidance of gains, and the avoidance of attendants.

original: Poṣv / sacet tatra kaścid evaṃ vadet /
analyzed: poṣu saced tatra kaścid evam vadet
translated: If someone there should say:

original: sāmānikāyāṃ āyuṣmantaḥ pravrajyāyāṃ kasmād ete bhikṣavo 'rhanti na vayam iti /
analyzed: sāmānikāyām āyuṣmantaḥ pravrajyāyām kasmāt ete bhikṣavaḥ rhanti na vayam iti
translated: Venerable ones, in this common going forth, why do these monks deserve [privileges] and we do not?
He should be addressed thus:

original: atītaśāstrake āyuṣman pravacane eṣa śāstā eṣa pratisaraṇaṃ yad uta sūtravinayamātṛkāś ceti /
analyzed: atīta śāstrake āyuṣman pravacane eṣa śāstā eṣa pratisaraṇam yat uta sūtra vinaya mātṛkāḥ ca iti
translated: Venerable one, in the past teachings of the Teacher, this was the teacher, this was the refuge, namely the sūtras, the discipline, and the mātṛkā.

original: sa caiṣam āyuṣmatāṃ vistareṇoddiṣṭaḥ pravṛttaś ceti /
analyzed: sa ca eṣam āyuṣmatām vistareṇa uddiṣṭaḥ pravṛttaḥ ca iti
translated: And that was expounded in detail by the Venerable One, and it was undertaken.

analyzed: tasmāt ete rhanti na tvam iti
translated: Therefore, they deserve it, but you do not.

original: Poṣv / / yathāpi tad eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyāṃ sārdhaṃvihāryantevāsikā bhikṣavo janapadacārikāṃ cartukāmā bhavanti /
analyzed: yathā api tat eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyām sārdhaṃvihāri antevāsikāḥ bhikṣavaḥ janapada cārikām cartu kāmāḥ bhavanti
translated: In the case of the Poṣadha: If on that very Poṣadha day of the fifteenth, the monks who are co-residents and disciples of the preceptor wish to go on a journey to the countryside,

original: teṣām ācāryopādhyāyair na kenacit prakāreṇāvalokanā dātavyā /
analyzed: teṣām ācārya upādhyāyaiḥ na kenacid prakāreṇa avalokanā dātavyā
translated: their teachers and preceptors should not give them any kind of permission.

original: Poṣv / / sacet tadrūpaḥ pratyayo bhavati vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: saced tad rūpaḥ pratyayaḥ bhavati vaktavyaḥ
translated: In the case of the Poṣadha: If there is such a condition, it should be said:

analyzed: āyuṣman amukaḥ āvāsaḥ sa sthaviraḥ sa prātimokṣaḥ
translated: Venerable one, such-and-such a dwelling place has elders and has the Prātimokṣa.

analyzed: saced tatra uktāḥ anyatra avataranti sa atisārāḥ bhavanti
translated: If they speak there and enter elsewhere, they will be guilty of a grave offense.

original: Poṣv / / atha bhagavāṃs tad eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyāṃ purastād bhikṣusaṃghasya prajñapta evāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tat eva poṣadhe paṃcadaśyām purastāt bhikṣu saṃghasya prajñapte eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: In the case of the Poṣadha: Then the Blessed One, on that very Poṣadha day of the fifteenth, sat down on the seat that was prepared in front of the assembly of monks.
Having sat down, the Blessed One addressed the monks:
In the case of the Poṣadha:
Monks, the night is passing.
Perform the Poṣadha, monks.

original: Poṣv / / athānyatamo bhikṣur utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantam idam avocat
analyzed: atha anyatamaḥ bhikṣuḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: Then a certain monk rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, put his palms together in the direction of the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: anyatamasmiṃ bhadantāvāse bhikṣur ābādhiko duḥkhito bāḍhaglānaḥ /
analyzed: anyatamasmin bhadanta āvāse bhikṣuḥ ābādhikaḥ duḥkhitaḥ bāḍha glānaḥ
translated: Venerable sir, in a certain monastery there is a sick monk who is suffering and gravely ill.
How should we proceed with him?
The Blessed One said:
His purity should be brought.

analyzed: uktam bhagavatā pāriśuddhiḥ asya ānayitavyā iti
translated: In the Poṣadhavastu it is said that the Blessed One said: His purity should be brought.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ na jānate katham ānayitavyā iti
translated: The monks did not know how it should be brought.
The Blessed One said:

original: ekasya ekena dvābhyām ekena saṃbahulānāṃ yāvatāṃ vā śaknoti saṃghamadhye nāmānaṃ parikīrtayituṃ /🔽Poṣv / / pāriśuddhidāyakasyāhaṃ bhikṣava bhikṣor āsamudācārikān dharmān prajñapayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: ekasya ekena dvābhyām ekena saṃbahulānām yāvatām vā śaknoti saṃgha madhye nāmānam parikīrtayitum  poṣu pāriśuddhi dāyakasya aham bhikṣava bhikṣoḥ āsamudācārikān dharmān prajñapayiṣyāmi
translated: By one for one, by two for one, by many for one, as many as one is able to announce the names in the midst of the Saṅgha.🔽In the Poṣadhavastu I will lay down the rules of conduct for a monk who gives purity.

original: Poṣv / / pāriśuddhidāyakena bhikṣuṇaikāṃsam uttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā upānahāv avamucya yathāvṛddhikayā sāmīcīṃ kṛtvā utkuṇḍakena Poṣv
analyzed: poṣu pāriśuddhidāyakena bhikṣuṇā eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā upānahau avamucya yathā vṛddhikayā sāmīcīm kṛtvā utkuṇḍakena
translated: In the Poṣadhavastu a monk who gives purity should put his upper robe over one shoulder, remove his sandals, perform the proper salutations according to seniority, and sit down cross-legged.

original: sthitvā añjaliṃ pragṛhya idaṃ syād vacanīyaṃ /
analyzed: sthitvā añjalim pragṛhya idam syāt vacanīyam
translated: Having stood up, holding out one's joined palms, one should say this:

original: samanvāharāyuṣmann adya saṃghasya poṣadhaḥ pāṃcadaśikaḥ mamāpy evaṃnāmo bhikṣoḥ poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikaḥ so 'ham evaṃnāmā bhikṣuḥ pariśuddham
analyzed: samanvāhara āyuṣman adya saṃghasya poṣadhaḥ pāṃcadaśikaḥ mama api evaṃnāmaḥ bhikṣoḥ poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikaḥ saḥ ham evaṃnāmā bhikṣuḥ pariśuddham
translated: Venerable one, please be attentive. Today is the fifteenth poṣadha of the Saṅgha, and it is also the fifteenth poṣadha of the monk named so-and-so. I, the monk named so-and-so, declare myself to be pure
with regard to the obstructing dharmas.

original: poṣadhe me pāriśuddhim ārocayāmy ārocitāṃ ca pravedayāmi /
analyzed: poṣadhe me pāriśuddhim ārocayāmi ārocitām ca pravedayāmi
translated: I announce my purity in the poṣadha. I announce what has been announced.

original: evaṃ dvir apy evaṃ trir api /
analyzed: evam dvis api evam tris api
translated: In this way, twice, in this way, three times.

original: Poṣv / / pāriśuddhidāyako bhikṣuḥ sacet kāyavijñaptyā pāriśuddhin dadāti /
analyzed: pāriśuddhi dāyakaḥ bhikṣuḥ saced kāya vijñaptyā dadāti
translated: If the monk who gives the purity in the poṣadha gives the purity with bodily expression,
the purity is given. It should be said:

analyzed: vāc Cp vijñaptyā SIF gb dadāti SPr3In
translated: If he gives with verbal expression,
the purity is given. It should be said:

analyzed: kāya vijñaptyā ca vāc vijñaptyā ca dadāti
translated: If he gives with both bodily and verbal expression,
the purity is given. It should be said:

original: Poṣv / / na kāyavijñaptyā na vāgvijñaptyā dadāti /🔽sarvasaṃghena vā tatra gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: na kāya vijñaptyā na vāc vijñaptyā dadāti  sarva saṃghena vā tatra gantavyam
translated: If he does not give with either bodily or verbal expression,🔽the entire Saṅgha should go there,

analyzed: sa vā bhikṣuḥ saṃgha madhye vatārayitavyaḥ
translated: or that monk should be brought into the midst of the Saṅgha.

analyzed: poṣu na sarva saṃghaḥ tatra gacchati
translated: In the Poṣadha, not all the Saṅgha goes there.

analyzed: tam ca bhikṣum saṃghe na avatārayiṣyanti
translated: And they will not bring that monk into the Saṅgha.
They perform it in disunity, they become offenders.
In the Poṣadha,

original: Poṣv / pāriśuddhidāyako bhikṣur yathāprajñaptān āsamudācārikāṃ dharmāṃ na samādāya vartate sātisāro bhavati /
analyzed: poṣu pāriśuddhi dāyakaḥ bhikṣuḥ yathā prajñaptān āsamudācārikān dharmān na samādāya vartate sa atisāraḥ bhavati
translated: In the Poṣadha, a monk who gives purification, if he does not conduct himself in accordance with the rules of training as prescribed, he becomes an offender.

original: Poṣv / / pāriśuddhigrāhakasyāhaṃ bhikṣava bhikṣor āsamudācārikān dharmān prajñapayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: poṣu pāriśuddhi grāhakasya aham bhikṣava bhikṣoḥ āsamudācārikān dharmān prajñapayiṣyāmi
translated: I will lay down for the monk who receives purification the rules of training to be observed.

original: Poṣv / / pāriśuddhigrāhakeṇa bhikṣuṇā pāriśuddhiṃ gṛhītvā na dhāvitavyaṃ /
analyzed: poṣu pāriśuddhi grāhakeṇa bhikṣuṇā pāriśuddhim gṛhītvā na dhāvitavyam
translated: A monk who receives purification, having received purification, should not run.
He should not hurry.
He should not jump. He should not make [others] jump.
He should not jump over a courtyard.
He should not stand above in the open air.

original: na bahiḥ sīmāṃ gantavyaṃ /🔽naikena pādena dvau niśreṇapadakāv abhiruhitavyau /
analyzed: na bahis sīmām gantavyam  na ekena pādena dvau niśreṇa padakau abhiruhitavyau
translated: He should not go outside the boundary.🔽He should not ascend two flights of stairs with one foot.

analyzed: na ekena pādena dvau sopānaka ḍevarau abhiruhitavyau
translated: He should not ascend two sets of steps with one foot.
He should not sleep.
He should not attain concentration.
In the Poṣadha,

original: Poṣv / / svapiti samāpadyate dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyāṃ garhyo bhavati yac cālajjitvena yac ca vaitarikatvena /
analyzed: poṣu svapiti samāpadyate dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām garhyaḥ bhavati yat ca alajji tvena yat ca vaitarika tvena
translated: In the Poṣadha, he should sleep, he should enter into meditation. For two reasons he becomes blameworthy: because of shamelessness and because of being a transgressor.

original: Poṣv / / yadā saṃghasthaviraḥ kathayaty anāgamanāyāyuṣmantaś chandaṃ ca pāriśuddiṃ cārocayata /
analyzed: poṣu yadā saṃgha sthaviraḥ kathayati an āgamanāya āyuṣmantaḥ chandam ca pāriśuddim ca ārocayata
translated: In the Poṣadha, when the elder of the Saṃgha says, Venerable ones, announce your consent and purity for not coming,
and Announce what has been announced,

analyzed: tena āntarika sa tena āntarika bhikṣoḥ puratas sthitvā vaktavyam
translated: then, standing in front of an intermediate monk, he should say,

analyzed: samanvāharaḥ āyuṣman amuṣmin āvāse bhikṣuḥ ābādhikaḥ duḥkhitaḥ bāḍha glānaḥ
translated: Pay attention, venerable one! In such-and-such a dwelling place, a monk is sick, suffering, and gravely ill.🔽Today is the fifteenth Poṣadha of the Saṃgha, and it is also the fifteenth Poṣadha of that monk. This monk named so-and-so declares himself pure

original: adya saṃghasya poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikas tasyāpi bhikṣoḥ poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikaḥ so 'yam evaṃnāmā bhikṣuḥ pariśuddham antarāyikair dharmair ātmānaṃ 🔽vedayati /
analyzed: adya saṃghasya poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikaḥ tasya api bhikṣoḥ poṣadhaḥ pāñcadaśikaḥ saḥ yam evaṃnāmā bhikṣuḥ pariśuddham antarāyikaiḥ dharmaiḥ ātmānam  vedayati
translated: with regard to the obstructing dharmas.

original: poṣadhe 'sya pāriśuddhim ārocayāmy ārocitāṃ ca pravedayāmi /
analyzed: poṣadhe sya pāriśuddhim ārocayāmi ārocitām ca pravedayāmi
translated: I announce his purity in the Poṣadha and make known what has been announced.
In the Poṣadha,

original: Poṣv / / pāriśuddhigrāhako bhikṣur āsamudācārikān dharmān na samādāya vartate sātisāro bhavati /
analyzed: pāriśuddhi grāhakaḥ bhikṣuḥ āsamudācārikān dharmān na samādāya vartate sa atisāraḥ bhavati
translated: if a monk who receives purity does not follow the rules of conduct, he becomes guilty.

original: Poṣv / / āyuṣmān upālī buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ pṛcchati /
